### Fix

### Why this works
`MD033` flags **any inline HTML**. Switching to Markdown syntax like `![alt](src)` and `[![alt](img)](link)` keeps the same content while staying within Markdownlint rules.

```
	modified:   README.md
	modified:   README2.md

Untracked files:
  (use "git add &lt;file&gt;..." to include in what will be committed)
	.cursorindexingignore
	.markdownlint-cli2.jsonc
	.specstory/

no changes added to commit (use "git add" and/or "git commit -a")

```
</details>
</tool-use>

<think><details><summary>Thought Process</summary>
**Troubleshooting PowerShell command**

I‚Äôm figuring out that when the string `$env:GH_TOKEN` expands in the current PowerShell session, it turns out empty before launching a new session. To fix this, I need to escape the `$` with `` `$ `` or use single quotes around `-Command`. So, I'll use: `powershell -NoProfile -Command 'if ($env:GH_TOKEN) { "GH_TOKEN_SET" } elseif ($env:GITHUB_TOKEN) { "GITHUB_TOKEN_SET" } else { "NO_TOKEN" }'`. But I have to keep the outer command in PowerShell since single quotes will be interpreted by the current shell.</details></think>
